name: House of Caravan
description: Taking place in a single mansion in Candlewood, northeast USA, in the early 20th Century, House of Caravan is a sinister adventure filled with dark secrets and vexing puzzles.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2 or higher Processor: Quadcore 2.40GHz Memory: 3 GB RAM Graphics: Video card with 512MB of VRAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 1 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or higher Processor: Quadcore 3.2GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Video card Nvidia or ATI with 1024MB of VRAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: A pretty short game, but well worth the $6. Not really horror, but an atmospheric, creepy game much more like 'Gone Home'. The puzzles are pretty strightforward, there were one or two that had me scratching my head, but all in all a good game. My only real complaints are that it could use a bit more optimization, and some of the physics on the items are a bit wonky. Recommended!
Thank you based Cr1TiKaL, good job on the WR : ^)

This is a game built around story, revealed to the player through documents and puzzles. My favourite puzzle was how to finish the game as quickly as possible using only a chair. I enjoyed finishing this game in 12.6 seconds.

An exploration game with trivial point-and-click adventuring, insignificant puzzles, and minor jump scares. The mansion is pretty and the visuals very atmospheric, but unfortunately the story is uninteresting, obvious, and very poorly told. The voice acting is very amateurish and breaks whatever atmosphere is created by the visuals.  There's some raw talent behind this game, but the production team really needs to sit down and design an engaging story before building a complete game.

I have read countless times from other reviews that this game or that game had clunky controls and I never really understood what that meant. After playing this game I can probably say I now do. Walking up stairs in this game felt like I was a stick of melting butter. Also the story is boring.
100% Completion in just over a hour and a half. Abit too short even for its price, I've seen alot more for less. A Amnesia like game but with 0 monsters etc. Worth a play at sale price.
